entry.title: Joule Studio: How to Create Document Grounding
entry.content:
Several people have reached out to me this week to describe the new way you set up document grounding with Joule Studio. So here goes.

What is Document Grounding

Many of you may know about Document Grounding, but for those who don't here's a very brief explanation.

  1. The basic way we use AI is to send a prompt to an LLM (a set of "indexed" information).
  2. If we want the LLM to take into account additional information it may not have, we can provide "context" (though the amount of "context" you are allowed to send may be constrained).

One of those pieces of context may come from a set of documents (e.g., housed in SharePoint or in the SAP BTP Object Store service). In order to use those documents as context we must perform Document Grounding, which takes the documents, "chunks" them into small pieces, and then "embeds" them so they can be used as context in our AI requests.

In Joule Studio, when we create agents, we essentially specify an LLM to handle specific types of prompts, and then provide context and instructions for what we want the agent to do.

The "Old" Way in Joule Studio

The old way we performed Document Grounding in Joule Studio was to go into AI Core and create a resource group, connect that resource group to a content store (e.g., the place we store the documents), and have AI Core chunk and embed the documents so we could use the content within an agent or for use when sending a prompt to AI Core. Joule Studio would be configured to connect with a specific AI Core, and the developer of an agent would type in the name of a resource group in AI Core to use with their agent.

Here we can see in the SAP AI Launchpad that we are connected to the "dbw" resource, and we have created a "pipeline" with documents.

If we click inside, we can see that this pipeline has 4 documents, each chunked and embedded. 

But doing this required going into the SAP AI Launchpad, creating Generic Secrets by encoding credentials in Base64, and several more steps in tools we may not be familiar with.

Joule Studio still makes use of the same mechanism in AI Core, but now takes care of creating all the artifacts behind the scene (and enables some new capabilities).  

 

1. Prerequisites

You need an instance of SAP AI Core, SAP AI  Launchpad and an S3-compatible document store such as the Object Store service in BTP. I won't go into setting these up, but you can find out more information here:

  • AI Core (extended plan)
  • AI Launchpad (standard plan, and pointing to your AI Core)
  • Object Store (s3 -standard plan)

The plans listed are what I am told is required, and happens to be what I have experimented with.

If you need more information, leave a comment.

Note you can define many instances of AI Core and Object Store to be used with Joule Studio.

 

2. Destinations

You need to set up destinations to AI Core and Object Store on both your SAP Build tenant and your Joule tenant. 

AI Core Destination

Get the service key of your AI Core instance, and create a destination as shown below.

Append /oauth/token to the url value of the service key and use this for the destination's Token Service URL.

Add the additional property sap-joule-studio-document-grounding-ai-core and set it to true. This makes the destination visible within the SAP Build Control Tower.

 

Object Store Destination

Similarly, get the service key for the object store service instance and set the following destination fields with the corresponding service field value:

Destination FieldService Key Field
URLaccess_key_id
Client IDhost (add https://)
Client Secretsecret_access_key
Token Service URLhost (add https://)

Add the following additional properties:

Additional PropertyValue
regionregion value from service key
bucketbucket value from service key
usernameusername value from service key
typeS3
sap-joule-studio-document-grounding-object-store
true

The additional property sap-joule-studio-document-grounding-object-store makes the destination visible within the SAP Build Control Tower.

 

3. Set Up in Control Tower

In the Control Tower, the SAP Build admin will decide:

  • From which object stores to create Document Grounding.
  • In which AI Core instances to create these Document Grounding pipelines.

The Control Tower now has a Joule section, including a Document Grounding tile so the admin can create Document Grounding and make it available to Joule Studio developers.

Click the Document Grounding tile. You can now create sets of Document Grounding.

Note that while in the SAP AI Launchpad you could create different pipelines with different sets of documents in the same resource group, here each object store will create a separate resource group.

Click Add.

Give the resource group a name.

Select the AI Core instance in which to create the resource group.

And finally select the object store whose documents you want to ground.

Click Add.

The status of the resource group will be Pending. 

After about a minute (depending on the size of the documents), the status will change to Completed.

(Early on, I occasionally got Error messages, or Pending simply remained for a long time, and sometimes they would alternate between those messages. In such cases, make sure the destinations are configured properly and make sure the documents in the Object Store are not corrupted.)

If you now look in SAP AI Launchpad, and go to SAP AI Core Administration > Resource Groups, you will see a new resource group whose name is the name you specified (without spaces) with a Unix timestamp appended.

Though the resource group should immediately appear on the Resource Groups page, it may take a few extra minutes for the resource group to appear on the Workspaces page. 

Once it does, you can select it and see the pipeline and Document Grounding inside the resource group. 

 

4. Add Document Grounding to Your Agent 

Now that the admin has set up a resource group and triggered the document grounding for a set of documents, developers of Joule Studio agents can use them in their agents.

Inside an agent, the developer can specify tools, including documents. Select Add Tools > Documents.

This opens a dialogue to specify which resource group created by the admin to use. Specify a name for the documents (as seen in the agent) and a description to help the agent know when to use them.

Then select from among the resource groups created by the admin.

Advantages

The advantages of this method are:

  • Admins and developers no longer have to work in AI Launchpad, including creating Generic Secrets and dealing with Base64 encoding of credentials.
  • Admins decide what document grounding gets used in Joule Studio agents.
    • From the look of the UI, admins will eventually be able to assign a resource group to a specific environment, giving admins even more control
  • Developers have a predefined set of  resource groups to choose from, using a dropdown list.
  • More than one AI Core instance and more than one Object Store instance can be used to define document grounding for a Joule Studio.

Note that this method creates a single document grounding pipeline in each resource group it creates; using AI Launchpad, you can create multiple pipelines in a single resource group.

There may be more advantages and limitations. Please add a comment with your opinion about this feature, or anything I missed.

entry.title: My highlights of the SAP Cloud ERP 2602 release
entry.content:
Welcome to 2026 and welcome to my SAP Cloud ERP 2602 product release highlights! This blog post guides you through the key improvements of the 2602 release of SAP Cloud ERP, focusing on how they support customers in running and evolving their core business processes. And it was again not easy to decide what to declare as highlights amongst the large number of innovations delivered. It's our 34th major release over the years, and I have collected an interesting range across functional, foundational and user experience capabilities. And of course, the AI journey continues to boost both well-known and new ERP processes to a new levels. We're all in on AI.

I wish the team would have granted me more space to talk you through all innovation shipped with the 2602 release , take this blog post as an appetizer for our team’s deep dive blogs per line of business. Prefer video over text? Take a look at my product update video, where my digital twin guides you through the key highlights. 

 

A new operating model for integrated business processes 

With the first release of 2026, we walk the talk of our SAP Business Suite and introduce a range of SAP-managed Integrated Business Processes, removing the complexity of integrating and monitoring multiple cloud solutions from our customer's and partner's activity list. We have carefully listened to your wishes and SAP delivers co-provisioning, functional and technical integration, including lifecycle management, allowing these activities to move in the background while customers focus on their core business. By shifting responsibility for aligned system provisioning, functional and technical integration, and lifecycle management from customers to SAP, we reduce complexity behind the scenes and enables a more seamless suite experience.

* Click here to access the links mentioned in the slide above

As an initial step, release 2602 delivers SAP-managed integration for two critical end-to-end processes as part of an Early Adopter Care (EAC) program. In Workforce Management, SAP provides SAP-managed provisioning and integration between SAP Cloud ERP and SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central, supporting a streamlined Recruit-to-Retire process with consistent employee and financial data from day one. For Operational Procurement, integrated processes across SAP Cloud ERP, SAP Ariba Buying, and SAP Ariba Central Invoice Management simplify Procure-to-Pay activities and support a more unified procurement landscape.

These capabilities are enabled by blueprint-based provisioning, which changes how solution instances are deployed, integrated, and managed across the run phase. Instead of manual setup, customers can activate selective solutions or in the future complete suites that are provisioned and come already fully integrated together. Guided by a new suite experience in SAP for Me and based on SAP landscape modeling best practices, SAP applies a desired-state-based reconciliation to ensure transparency, consistency, and long-term stability across the application landscape.

 

AI innovations

SAP Joule for Consultants: Practical enhancements for your everyday project work

With this first release of year 2026, SAP Joule for Consultants continues to mature as a day-to-day companion for project focused workers, offering efficient access to trusted content, better transparency, and smoother workflows – on demand. A new SAP Joule for Consultants console brings ‘What’s New’ release notes, an integrated prompt library, and, where relevant, administrative insights such as usage metrics and system settings into one central entry point, helping teams stay aligned with current innovations.

 

 

Joule now also surfaces SAP Notes and SAP Knowledge Base Articles (KBAs) directly within conversations, based on existing customer entitlements. This allows consultants to reference validated SAP guidance without leaving their context, while administrators retain control through standard s-user assignments. Usability improvements further support efficient work: Quick links simplify navigation across Joule features, the conversation character limit has been increased to 10,000 characters to accommodate larger inputs such as code or detailed scenarios, and public SAP content sources have been refreshed and expanded.

Enhanced citation visibility improves transparency by clearly indicating the origin of information, including public web sources when applicable.

 

Finally, the initial ingestion of SAP Signavio Process Navigator reference content lays the groundwork for more architecture-aware guidance in future releases.

 

Finance

Accounting Accruals Agent (beta)

In the dynamic landscape of financial management, the introduction of the beta version of Accounting Accruals Agent marks a thoughtful stride towards empowering finance professionals with innovative tools tailored for efficiency. This intelligent agent draws from AI-driven capabilities to meticulously craft accrual proposals, transforming the traditionally labor-intensive process into a streamlined operation. By analyzing accounting policy documents, sifting through historical data, and executing precise calculations, this agent reduces the substantial time accountants typically spend during period-end accruals. The newfound simplicity in the ‘Manage Accrual Proposals’ app not only enhances the speed of reviewing and posting proposals but also offers detailed, AI-backed explanations for each calculated entry. This ensures that general ledger accountants gain not just time but also trust in AI’s role in augmenting their decision-making processes, thereby enabling a smoother and more efficient period-end close. This feature is going to be made generally available in SAP Cloud ERP 2602.

 

SAP User Experience

AI-assisted task automation (beta)

In everyday work, many tasks in SAP Cloud ERP follow the same patterns: Reviewing data, triggering follow-up steps, or keeping processes moving. With AI-assisted task automation, SAP introduces smart helpers that support users exactly in these moments. Built with generative AI and embedded directly in My Home, these helpers can take over routine steps within SAP applications while keeping users in control whenever decisions or data changes are required. Instead of replacing human judgement, the focus is on reducing manual effort and helping users progress through their tasks more smoothly. Over time, this creates a more natural way of working with automation, one that adapts to real user needs and daily workflows. Customers interested in shaping this capability early can join the beta program to explore the feature and provide feedback that will influence future AI-driven experiences in SAP Cloud ERP.

Check out this link to sign up for the beta testing and shape the future of AI innovations: https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#campaign/4086 

 

Retail

Assortment module management 

Many non-retail industries integrate retail capabilities into their ERP systems to enhance customer services and collaboration, even in B2B. Most organizations today are expected to react faster to changing customer expectations while keeping operations efficient and scalable. This requires tools that simplify everyday work for planners and merchandisers, reduce operational friction, and make it easier to translate data and insights into action. In this context, intelligent assistance within core retail processes becomes increasingly important, especially where decisions around assortments directly influence customer experience and business outcomes.

In the area of Retail, Joule’s integration into assortment module management supports planners by making common tasks more accessible and less time-consuming. Instead of navigating multiple screens, users can rely on natural language interactions to create, update, or terminate assortments directly within the application. This reduces dependency on deep technical knowledge and helps teams complete routine tasks with greater confidence and efficiency. As a result, merchandising and category managers can spend less time on operational steps and more time focusing on assortment strategy and customer-centric planning.

For more information, please consult SAP Help Portal.

 

Asset Management

Maintenance notification creation and screening with Joule

In Asset Management, keeping maintenance processes running smoothly depends on timely and accurate notifications, often created under time pressure and by users outside of specialized maintenance roles. With Joule integrated into the maintenance notification process in SAP Cloud ERP, creating and screening notifications becomes more straightforward and accessible. Users can describe an issue in natural language and capture key details such as the technical object, priority, and description without navigating complex transaction flows. Moreover, users can access notifications in the ‘Manage Maintenance Notification’ SAP Fiori app (F5777), enabling quick acceptance and conversion into maintenance orders within a single conversational context. As a result, operators spend less time on documentation, while maintenance teams and managers benefit from clearer, more consistent information to plan and execute maintenance activities effectively.

 

SAP Activate innovations

SAP Activate introduces several innovations for the 2602 release, starting with a dedicated activation and implementation guidance for customers adopting SAP-managed integrations in the Early Adopter Care program, mentioned earlier.

Customers implementing SAP Cloud ERP will continue to benefit from easier access to implementation information with Joule, which is embedded in the ’Roadmap Viewer’ application on SAP for Me. Additionally, implementation teams can access up-to-date implementation guidance in nine languages: Chinese, English, French, German, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Portuguese, and Spanish. Change your language preferences in SAP for Me to view content in another language.

Customers conducting the upgrade to the 2602 release can leverage the lean upgrade roadmap in the ‘Roadmap Viewer’ app or in SAP Cloud ALM to guide their team through the upgrade and post-upgrade activities. 

 

SAP Cloud ALM updates

In transformation projects, teams often invest a lot of time turning workshop outcomes, documents, and process discussions into structured requirements and test assets. With the latest updates in SAP Cloud ALM, this work becomes more streamlined across the project lifecycle. AI-assisted  requirements generation helps teams create initial requirements automatically based on Fit-to-Standard workshop transcripts, solution processes, and other project documentation, giving project members a solid starting point that can be reviewed and refined instead of built from scratch.

As project scopes evolve, requirements can now be moved easily between projects, supporting reuse and reducing duplication.

 

 Further enhancements focus on governance and test preparation.

New APIs for manual test cases, process hierarchies, and features make it easier to integrate SAP Cloud ALM into existing tool landscapes and automate project reporting or oversight. All SAP Cloud ALM APIs can be found on the SAP Business Accelerator Hub.

During test preparation, teams can now define where screenshots are required as test evidence, improving transparency and auditability during execution.

 

Updates to release assessment and scope dependency

Smarter upgrades in SAP Cloud ERP require a clear understanding of customer´s individually relevant applications and scope items. The release assessment and scope dependency (RASD) tool continues to evolve, incorporating customer feedback to make impact analysis more transparent and easier to work with. Recent updates simplify how assessment results are shared, allowing users to download content across all tiles, or selected ones, into a single ZIP file with structured Excel outputs that can be reviewed, filtered, and discussed across distributed project teams.

Beyond usability improvements, RASD now provides more precise guidance for upgrade decisions. The introduction of a successor view helps identify recommended follow-on apps, supporting smoother transition planning.

In addition, enhanced views in the personalized 'What’s New Viewer' clearly differentiate between activated, used, and impacted scope items, helping teams focus on what truly matters in their system.

Together, these enhancements support more informed discussions, reduce uncertainty during release preparation, and help teams approach upgrades with greater clarity and confidence.

 

Other innovations across various LoBs

Supply Chain Management – Warehouse management

Interface to warehouse automation systems for efficiently processing warehouse orders

In the evolving landscape of warehouse management, the integration of warehouse automation systems is set to significantly enhance operational efficiency. By seamlessly distributing warehouse orders to automated subsystems, businesses can ensure smooth and coordinated task execution. This interface not only sends out orders but also receives confirmations of warehouse tasks, creating a continuous feedback loop that ensures transparency and efficiency. Such integration significantly cuts down manual intervention, allowing for a more streamlined process that minimizes errors and enhances productivity. The main advantage lies in the ability to process warehouse orders more efficiently, capitalizing on automation to handle tasks that were once labor-intensive. This means warehouse operations can maintain a high level of accuracy while handling greater volumes, ultimately enhancing the overall supply chain performance and reliability.

 

 

Manufacturing

Production order combination enablement

In the Manufacturing line of business, we are happy to introduce production order combination enablement, which offers a practical solution to streamline operations and enhance efficiency. By merging identical operations from different production orders into a single consolidated order, manufacturers can optimize their processes right from the ‘Manage Production Orders’ app. This functionality allows for the creation, maintenance, and confirmation of combined orders, which in turn supports effective cost distribution and settlement through new event-based costing. By reducing setup times and overhead charges, this approach not only increases production throughput but also achieves considerable cost savings. This feature empowers manufacturers to focus their efforts on boosting output while maintaining a keen eye on cost efficiency, creating a more agile and responsive production environment.

 

Professional Services

Intercompany cost allocations reconciliation review booklet

In the Professional Services domain, the enhancement of the ‘Intercompany Review Booklet’ app offers a significant boost in transparency and traceability for intercompany cost allocations. By displaying the complete end-to-end document flow, this app helps reconcile management accounting postings with billing and accounts receivable documents. This comprehensive view is invaluable during closing procedures, as it allows businesses to ensure their data's completeness by clearly identifying services and expenses that have been billed, are partially billed, or remain unbilled. Furthermore, the app provides audit-relevant information on billed intercompany services, offering businesses the assurance and documentation needed for clear internal and external audits. This capability aids organizations in maintaining robust financial processes while enhancing their ability to track and manage intercompany transactions efficiently. Starting with release 2602, the report will include an enhanced breakdown of billed entries, tracing them all the way to the receiver FI journal entry/affiliated expenses.  

 

Enterprise Portfolio and Project Management

Enhanced integration of project plan information with SAP Cloud ERP

In the domain of Enterprise Portfolio and Project Management, enhancing the integration of project plan information with SAP Cloud ERP was one of the items discussed and designed in our customer product councils. This innovation facilitates seamless synchronization of project plan data between SAP Cloud ERP and SAP Project and Resource Management, enabling a more cohesive project management experience. Users can manually trigger updates to project dates in SAP Cloud ERP, ensuring that information remains current and accurate. Furthermore, the automated bi-directional synchronization of project plan data significantly reduces the manual effort involved in data maintenance, allowing teams to focus on strategic initiatives. With greater scope control and improved integration, organizations can enjoy comprehensive visibility of critical information across different solutions, thus enhancing data quality and operational efficiency. This development empowers project managers with the tools needed to effectively monitor and control project progress, fostering better decision-making and resource allocation throughout the project lifecycle.

 

Summary

I hope this overview of the SAP Cloud ERP 2602 release highlights has provided helpful insights into the latest updates and enhancements as well as excitement for the upgrade. As SAP Cloud ERP continues to evolve, these innovations aim to support more efficient processes, clearer guidance, and a smoother experience across implementations and upgrades.

Let me know which innovation stands out most to you and what your personal highlights from this release are: Feel free to share your thoughts in the comments.

In the coming weeks, we’ll take a closer look at additional business- and industry-specific innovations in follow-up blogs. Be sure to visit our community page to connect with SAP experts, ask questions, and exchange feedback. To stay up to date with future content, follow the PSCC_Enablement tag and keep an eye out for upcoming posts.

Feel free to follow me at BeSchulze in the community and on LinkedIn to not miss any updates. 

Let’s keep advancing together—towards a smarter, more connected cloud ERP future.

Yours,

Bert

entry.title: AI innovations highlights in SAP Cloud ERP 2602
entry.content:
The release of SAP Cloud ERP 2602 continues SAP’s focus on embedding intelligence directly into business processes, quietly, purposefully, and where it matters most. In this blog, you’ll find a guided look at the key AI innovations introduced with the 2602 release, as highlighted in the product blog post by Bert Schulze. Rather than showcasing AI as a standalone capability, the focus is on how these innovations support customers in running, adapting, and evolving their core business processes across finance, sales, manufacturing, procurement, and beyond.

With the 2602 release, SAP Cloud ERP builds on its existing foundation by supporting everyday work with intelligence that is more contextual, connected, and task focused. At the heart of this evolution is an agentic AI framework, where specialized, task-specific agents take on clearly defined responsibilities based on real business context, data, and rules. These agents work together behind the scenes, while Joule serves as the orchestration layer that brings insights, recommendations, and next steps together in a natural, conversational way. Whether supporting a finance expert with complex classifications or helping teams respond faster to operational issues, intelligence is applied exactly where decisions are made. Take a moment to explore the accompanying video for a closer look at how these AI-driven capabilities quietly support everyday work and point toward a more adaptive way of running enterprise processes.

Take a look at the short video below to see how these AI-driven capabilities quietly support everyday work and are shaping a more adaptive way of running enterprise processes.

 

Agentic AI use case highlights

Finance

International Trade Classification Agent (beta)

When a single misclassified product can delay a shipment or trigger compliance questions, international trade classification quickly becomes a task where precision matters as much as speed. Inthe 2602 release, the International Trade Classification Agent supports product classification specialists in this sensitive part of the process by reasoning over product characteristics and applicable trade regulations. It proposes customs tariff numbers and commodity codes and explains how each recommendation was derived, making review and approval straightforward. This shifts the expert’s role from manual lookup to informed validation, while keeping full transparency and auditability. In practice, teams can expect significantly less effort spent on repetitive classification tasks, up to a 50% reduction, while lowering the risk of non-compliance.

 

Accounting Accruals Agent

Period-end accruals are a familiar pressure point in finance: important, repetitive, and often constrained by tight timelines. The beta version of the Accounting Accruals Agent tackles this challenge by supporting teams with proposing accruals based on accounting policy documents, historical data, and calculated values, helping shift the work from manual preparation to focused review. Accrual proposals are presented directly in the ‘Manage Accrual Proposals’ app, along with clear explanations that show how each figure was derived. This transparency makes it easier for general ledger accountants to validate and post accruals with confidence, without losing control over the process. As a result, teams can reduce the time spent on period-end activities while maintaining consistency and auditability, supporting a smoother close cycle.

For more information, see Accounting Accruals Agent.

 

Embedded AI highlights

Sales

Automatic creation of sales orders from unstructured data (premium) - AnyDOX adoption

Sales teams often receive purchase orders in formats that don’t fit neatly into systems, PDFs attached to emails, scanned documents, or images that still require careful manual entry. With the current release, internal sales representatives can upload these unstructured files and let the system extract the relevant information into a sales order request, proposing values such as the sold-to party based on the document content. What used to be a repetitive transcription task becomes a short review step, allowing sales teams to focus more on customer interactions and less on administrative work. Multilanguage support and the ability to train the extraction logic through SAP Document AI help ensure the process works reliably across regions and document types. The result is a smoother order intake process that reduces manual effort while keeping sales operations responsive and consistent.

Check out this dedicated page on SAP Help Portal to learn more.

 

Finance

Period comparisons and AI insights for product profitability review booklet

Looking at product profitability often starts with a simple question: What changed and why? The latest enhancements to the product profitability review booklet help sales accountants explore this question more systematically by introducing period comparisons for margins and cost of goods sold. Built-in views for margin overview and COGS breakdown are complemented by AI-generated insights that highlight notable developments between periods, offering guidance on where a closer look may be worthwhile. Additional dimensions, functional currency display, and an extensible CDS view support more flexible market segment analysis without losing consistency. Together with the new commenting feature, this creates a clearer, more connected view of product performance that supports informed discussions and decisions.

For more information, discover enhancements in the product profitability review booklet.

 

Manufacturing

AI-assisted production routing proposal and copy routing

Creating a new production routing often starts by searching for something that already exists and adapting it to fit, an approach that works, but takes time and careful attention. The newly introduced innovation, AI-assisted production routing proposal and copy routing, supports production engineers, planners, and master data specialists by identifying similar routings based on material names, descriptions, and bills of material. Instead of rebuilding routings from the ground up, users receive suggestions they can copy and adjust, turning setup work into a focused refinement step. This helps reduce repetitive data entry and lowers the risk of inconsistencies across routings. Over time, teams benefit from faster setup, more consistent master data, and a smoother path from planning to production.

Eager to learn more? Check out our dedicated pages on intelligent scenario to find similar materials for routing proposal and creating a routing using the AI-assisted material search.

 

 

Cross topic: Situation handling

AI-assisted situation handling (beta)

When critical issues surface in day-to-day operations, the real challenge is often not awareness but knowing what to do next. This is where AI-assisted situation handling comes into play, supporting business users by complementing automated alerts with context-aware guidance tailored to their roles and responsibilities. By capturing situation data together with its business context, the system can generate targeted recommendations that help users assess options and act more quickly. Customizable prompts and the ability to incorporate data from SAP, third-party, and external sources ensure that advice reflects real operational conditions. In practice, this leads to faster resolution of situations, cutting response times by up to 70%, and helps teams stay focused on decisions rather than diagnostics.

 

 

Joule innovations highlights

Procurement

Conversational search for local and central purchase requisition status

Tracking the status of a purchase requisition often means switching between apps, systems, and document numbers just to answer a simple question. With the latest updates, conversational search in Joule allows procurement users to ask directly about the status of local or central purchase requisitions and their follow-on documents, without navigating into multiple SAP Fiori apps. Users can reference familiar identifiers, such as requisition numbers, connected-system document IDs, or SAP Ariba cart numbers and receive the relevant status in one place. This shortens the path from question to answer and reduces interruptions in daily work. Over time, procurement teams gain faster visibility into requisition progress and can respond to inquiries with greater confidence and less effort.

 

Conversational search for centrally managed purchase requisition status

Similarly to the innovation described above, conversational search in Joule allows users to check the approval and follow-on document status of centrally managed purchase requisitions without switching between SAP Fiori apps. A simple query is enough to see whether a requisition has progressed to a purchase order, acknowledgment, goods receipt, or invoice receipt. This removes friction from everyday follow-ups and helps teams stay informed without interrupting their workflow. As a result, procurement professionals can respond faster to internal requests and keep processes moving smoothly.

 
Conversational search for central procurement business documents

In central procurement , finding the right document often means knowing exactly where to look and having the time to navigate there. With this release conversational search in Joule allows users to search and filter central procurement business documents simply by asking, whether they are looking for contracts nearing expiration, rejected supplier confirmations, or purchase orders tied to a specific supplier or system. Results are presented together with direct navigation links to the relevant SAP Fiori apps, turning search into a natural entry point rather than a separate task. This makes it easier to move from question to action without breaking focus. Over time, procurement teams gain faster access to the information they need and more confidence in managing centrally governed processes.

 

Don’t miss: The GenAI extensibility assistant

As we roll out the new 2602 features, we also want to highlight a game-changer from the previous cycle that is rapidly becoming a standard for key users. If you haven't yet explored the GenAI-based extensibility assistant, now is the time. This tool allows key users to generate custom fields and logic simply by describing their requirements in natural language. It’s not just about speed; it ensures your logic is consistent and "clean core" compliant by design. To see this assistant in action and learn how to enable it, check out this deep dive on extensibility assistant for key users.

entry.title: How GenAI Is Changing SAP Application Development on SAP BTP
entry.content:
Generative AI is rapidly becoming a core enabler in enterprise application development, and SAP Business Technology Platform plays a key role in making this adoption practical and scalable. From accelerating development to improving user experience, GenAI is reshaping how SAP solutions are designed and delivered.

SAP BTP provides a flexible foundation where GenAI services can be embedded into existing SAP landscapes without disrupting core systems. By leveraging SAP BTP, organizations can keep their core clean while innovating at the edge using AI-driven capabilities.

One of the most common use cases of GenAI on SAP BTP is intelligent application development. Developers can use AI-assisted tools to generate code snippets, improve logic quality, and reduce development time. This is especially useful in extension scenarios where custom logic is required without modifying the core S/4HANA system.

Another major area is business automation and decision support. GenAI can analyze large volumes of transactional and unstructured data, generate insights, and assist business users with natural language queries. This reduces dependency on technical teams and improves operational efficiency.

GenAI also enhances user experience through conversational interfaces. Chatbots and virtual assistants built on SAP BTP can interact with SAP applications in natural language, helping users retrieve information, complete tasks, and resolve issues faster.

Security and governance remain critical, and SAP BTP addresses this by offering enterprise-grade controls, role-based access, and compliance-ready AI services. This ensures organizations can adopt GenAI responsibly while protecting sensitive business data.

To get started, organizations should identify high-impact use cases such as reporting, automation, or application extensions. Starting small with pilot projects on SAP BTP allows teams to measure value quickly and scale GenAI initiatives with confidence.

In conclusion, GenAI on SAP BTP is not about replacing developers or business users, but empowering them. With the right strategy and platform, enterprises can unlock faster innovation, better decision-making, and more intelligent SAP applications.

entry.title: Artificial Intelligence in SAP Cloud ERP 2602
entry.content:
Welcome to your one-stop shop to learn and share knowledge about SAP's ready-to-run public cloud ERP software solution.   

SAP Cloud ERP is part of SAP Business Suite that brings AI, data, and applications together into a fully integrated system. This community is open for anyone in the cloud ERP ecosystem–customers, partners, and SAP experts.  

In this blog, I’m thrilled to guide you through the latest AI innovations in our SAP Cloud ERP release 2602. This release marks a significant leap forward in our journey to embed reliable, relevant, and responsible AI directly into the core of your ERP. Our goal is simple: to make your work smarter, your decisions faster, and your daily tasks more intuitive.

With our AI co-pilot Joule and a host of new embedded AI capabilities, we're transforming the user experience and delivering tangible business value across every line of business. Let's dive into the highlights!

A Smarter Foundation: Cross-Topic AI Innovations

We're embedding AI into the very fabric of the user experience, making the system more proactive, helpful, and personalized for every user.

1. Situation handling

1.1. AI-assisted situation handling (release 2602.1)

Solve business challenges faster and smarter with AI-powered recommendations:

  • Instant, Personalized Guidance: Get tailored advice right when you need it, helping you resolve business issues quickly and confidently.
  • Flexible and Customizable: Adapt the solution to your unique business logic—make changes easily and keep your processes up to date.
  • Effortless Access to Knowledge: Find the information you need, even beyond SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, with simplified, contextual support.

Key Features:

  • Generate actionable recommendations based on your specific business context.
  • Create and manage prompts to ensure solutions are relevant and effective.
  • Enrich recommendations with data from multiple sources for deeper insights.

With AI-Assisted Situation Handling, you empower your team to work smarter, make better decisions, and stay agile in a fast-changing business environment.

For more information, see: Situation Handling

Discovery Center

 

2. User experience

2.1. AI-assisted error explanation for SAP Fiori elements-based Applications

With AI-assisted error explanations for SAP Fiori elements-based applications, you’ll save valuable time, boost reliability, and make maintenance easier than ever. Faster resolution of errors with the support of generative AI:

  • Speed Up Maintenance: Let generative AI quickly explain errors and recommend solutions, so you spend less time fixing issues and more time driving your business forward.
  • Reduce Future Errors: Understand the root causes behind problems, helping you prevent similar issues from happening again.

For more information, see: Discovery Center

 

2.2. AI-assisted smart personalization of My Home for applications

Tailor My Home experience using natural language and transform your workspace with just a few words:

  • Natural Language Personalization: Simply tell SAP what you need—AI understands your requests and instantly suggests the most relevant apps for your daily tasks.
  • Quick and Easy Setup: Add new applications to your “My Home” in seconds. Preview AI-generated suggestions before confirming, so you always get what fits best.
  • Save Time, Boost Productivity: No more searching through menus. AI streamlines your workflow, making it ideal for both new and occasional users.
  • Trustworthy Recommendations: Rely on intelligent, data-driven suggestions that ensure accuracy and build confidence in your setup.
  • Seamless Experience: Enjoy a smooth, click-minimizing process with a preview-based confirmation—making personalization simple and enjoyable.

Unlock the full potential of SAP Cloud ERP by letting AI tailor your “My Home” to your needs—so you can focus on what matters most

For more information, see: Discovery Center

 

2.3. AI-assisted easy fill of SAP Fiori elements-based applications

Let AI handle the details—just describe what you need, and watch your forms fill themselves:

  • Save Time Instantly: Maintain all the fields on your object pages in seconds, thanks to seamless AI-powered automation.
  • No More Guesswork: Simply use natural language, and the system intelligently matches your words to the right fields—no more hunting through forms.

With AI-assisted easy fill, you’ll breeze through data entry, reduce manual effort, and focus on what matters most in your business.

For more information, see: Discovery Center

 

2.4. AI-assisted task automation (beta)

AI-assisted task automation is the next embedded AI feature in the SAP Fiori user experience of SAP Cloud ERP. It builds on the previously delivered features such as easy filter, easy fill and smart solutions for situations in My Home.​

It allows key users and end users to automate their daily activities in SAP’s Fiori apps by using generative AI to create so called “smart helpers”. Those ”smart helpers” execute the repetitive activities on behalf of the end user either from the SAP Fiori launchpad or from individual SAP Fiori apps while always keeping the user in the loop for decisions on data changes.​

Benefits:

  • Easy to use SAP Fiori application to create “smart helpers”​
  • Full control of what the “smart helper” proposes to do​
  • Intuitive way of running the “smart helper” while being always in control in case of changes​
  • Supports all SAP Fiori elements-based applications​

Key features:

  • Creation of “smart helpers” based on all available SAP Fiori elements-based applications in SAP Cloud ERP​
  • Generation and validation of execution plan for “smart helpers”​
  • Run time for “smart helpers” is integrated into My Home the product homepage of SAP Cloud ERP​

Please register to be part of the SAP Beta Testing of the Newest AI Innovations in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

 

2.5. AI-assisted smart solution for situations (beta)

AI-assisted smart solution for situations in My Home simplifies workflows by dynamically adapting the user interface to guide business users through resolution steps using the power of generative AI

Directly on the SAP Cloud ERP homepage, users can resolve operational situations in just a few clicks. AI-driven recommendations accelerate decision-making and streamline user actions for improved efficiency

Benefits:

  • Drives time efficiency by eliminating navigation through intelligent UI design
  • Enhances decision-making with timely, context-aware AI recommendations
  • Delivers trustworthy AI-generated results, built on enterprise-grade intelligence
  • Offers an intuitive, click-efficient experience, empowering users to act confidently with minimal effort.

Key features:

  • Key information and actions are surfaced through dynamic cards reducing the need for in-depth navigation
  • Enables one-click resolution of situations directly from the homepage thereby enhancing operational efficiency within SAP Cloud ERP
  • Situation types supported:
  • End date for project reached but stage not completed
  • Alert for bank messages
  • Expiring Sales Quotations

Please register to be part of the SAP Beta Testing of the Newest AI Innovations in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

 

AI Innovations Across Lines of Business:

3. Finance

3.1. Accounting Accruals agent (beta)

Close Your Books Faster with the AI-Powered Accounting Accruals Agent

The agent helps accountants to automate journal entry preparation for accruals by analyzing historical data and leveraging accounting policy documents. It calculates accurate amounts and provides a pre-populated list of journal entries for review and confirmation. Your accounts will increase their productivity, ensure timely month-end close, and get more time for high-value activities.

  • Automate Journal Entries: Let AI handle the heavy lifting by preparing accrual journal entries for you—twice as fast as before.
  • Boost Accuracy: The agent analyzes your historical data and accounting policies to calculate precise accrual amounts, reducing errors and manual work.
  • Ready-to-Review Entries: Receive a pre-populated list of journal entries, so your team can quickly review and confirm, saving valuable time.
  • Focus on What Matters: Free up your accountants to concentrate on high-value activities, ensuring a timely and efficient month-end close.

Business Impact:

  • Cut time spent on accrual calculations and deferrals by up to 80%
  • Reduce review and posting time by 50%
  • Achieve a faster, smoother period-end close

For more information, see: Discovery Center

 

3.2. International trade classification agent (beta)

Classify your products for international shipping in seconds—no expertise required

This agent helps product classification specialists to classify goods for shipping. The agent reasons over product characteristics and trade regulations and acts to classify goods for international shipping. The agent recommends customs tariff numbers and commodity codes, providing rationale for easy review and approval.

This agent will help ensure compliance with global trade regulations and reduce the risk of manual errors with robust governance and a clear, audit-ready decision

  • Automatic Classification: Let AI analyze your product details and trade regulations to instantly recommend the right customs tariff numbers and commodity codes.
  • Ensure Compliance: Rely on recommendations that are reasoned from both product characteristics and up-to-date trade rules, helping you meet global regulations with confidence.
  • Reduce Risk: Eliminate manual errors with a robust, auditable decision process—every classification comes with clear rationale for easy review and approval.

Business Impact:

  • 50% reduction in effort to classify international trade products

For more information, see: Discovery Center

 

3.3. Sales accounting: period comparisons and business insights for Product Profitability Review Booklet

The Product Profitability Review Booklet enables you, as a Sales Accountant, to analyze the profitability for products sold using built-in business pages for the Margin Overview and the Cost of Goods Sold (COGS) Breakdown.

Benefits:

  • Gain deeper insights into margins and cost of goods sold (COGS) with period comparisons
  • Enable informed decision-making with AI-enabled financial business insights
  • Support flexible market segment analysis with an extensible CDS view
  • Improve visibility with additional currency types and dimensions

Key features:

Enhancements to the Product Profitability Review Booklet app that:

  • Provide new period comparisons for product profitability

entry.title: Generating and Integrating Automated Predictive Library (APL) Forecasts in a Seamless Planning Model
entry.content:
Introduction 

SAP Analytics Cloud has always been the one solution for BI, planning and predictive analytics. As such, it has powerful built-in capabilities for regression, classification and time-series forecasting. You know them as Predictive Scenarios and many of you have used them to support their planning processes. Our predictive scenarios are perfect for business users: they choose the best available algorithm for your data and explain the results while maintaining the semantics of the model throughout the process (e.g., hierarchies). With SAP Business Data Cloud and seamless planning, data scientists on the other hand can now leverage HANA’s predictive Predictive Analysis Library (PAL) and Automated Predictive Library (APL) directly on the HANA database of SAP Datasphere and nicely integrate the results into planning processes. This lets them tweak predictive models by picking and choosing the algorithm of their choice and use code instead of a UI. SAP BDC would also allow them to share data with SAP Databricks or another Databricks instance using data products if this was their preferred environment. 

This blogpost was created with @marc_daniau, a development expert for our predictive engine. We want to demonstrate the usage of HANA APL in combination with a seamless planning model and live versions. We do this using a straight-forward prediction based on actual data.  

 

High-level overview 

This is what we are working with: 

In SAP Analytics Cloud, we have a planning model deployed to an SAP Datasphere space. That makes it a seamless planning model which means that its data is not stored on the SAP Analytics Cloud database but only on the SAP Datasphere database.  

In the SAP Datasphere space, we find the planning model data and a table with actuals. We are not using an SAP BDC data product, but you surely could! 

We create our prediction directly on the underlying HANA Cloud database of SAP Datasphere. We created a DB user to access the database. There, we consume the actuals, create a stored procedure which we can trigger via a task chain, and surface the result in a view in the space. This fact data can then be added to the seamless planning model as a live version.  

 

Step-by-step 

1. Seamless planning model 

We do not cover the full creation and set-up of the model. Let’s just check out its key characteristics:  

  • It is a seamless planning model, deployed to the space Sales Planning Demo 
  • Its fact table is exposed in the SAP Datasphere space (actually, this is not decisive for the use case described here but could be useful if you want to add budget data as influence for your predictive model, for instance) 
  •  We want to create a forecast version and predict the measure SALES_REVENUE along the product and region dimension 

2. SAP Datasphere space

Again, we do not look at the creation of the space and all its artefacts. The following Actuals view is key as we extrapolate our forecast based on this data: 

  • Measures and attributes nicely match the planning model structure (which is handy for our simple demo scenario J) 
  • We excluded columns that we do not need in a projection 
  • We filtered on date as we do not want to use the entire history 

3. Setting up database access 

We are now ready to learn how to create the forecast on the HANA database. First of all, we need to set up database access.  

  • Prerequisite: Enable the SAP HANA Cloud Script Server on Your SAP Datasphere Tenant 
  • Navigate to Space Management, find your space and Edit.  
  • Navigate to Database Access and create a new user 
     
  • Name your user and make the needed settings as highlighted. Your user’s name will be a concatenation of your space name, ‘#’ and the suffix you provide here. 
     
  • Mark your user and open the database explorer. The password can be retrieved in the details of the user (information symbol).  

4. Database explorer 

Let’s first have an overview of what we are creating in the database explorer: 

 

  • We create a view that consumes the actual data from our space schema. Note the following: 
  • We concatenate Product and Region to one Entity column that we will use to segment our prediction. As we work directly on flat fact tables/views, we do not have the luxury of keeping all semantics as we have it in the SAP Analytics Cloud predictive scenarios.  

 

CREATE VIEW "SALES_PLANNING_DEMO#AI_USER"."APL_SERIES_IN" ( "Entity", "Date", "SalesRevenue" ) AS (select   
  "Product" || '|' || "Regions" as "Entity", "Date", "SalesRevenue" 
 from  
  SALES_PLANNING_DEMO."V_Actual_Sales_Data" 
 order by 1, 2)

  • We now create the prediction task as a stored procedure.  
create procedure "APL_FORECAST_TASK" 
as BEGIN
    declare header "SAP_PA_APL"."sap.pa.apl.base::BASE.T.FUNCTION_HEADER";
    declare config "SAP_PA_APL"."sap.pa.apl.base::BASE.T.OPERATION_CONFIG_DETAILED";
	declare var_desc "SAP_PA_APL"."sap.pa.apl.base::BASE.T.VARIABLE_DESC_OID";   
    declare var_role "SAP_PA_APL"."sap.pa.apl.base::BASE.T.VARIABLE_ROLES_WITH_COMPOSITES_OID";    
    declare apl_log   "SAP_PA_APL"."sap.pa.apl.base::BASE.T.OPERATION_LOG";      
    declare apl_sum   "SAP_PA_APL"."sap.pa.apl.base::BASE.T.SUMMARY";   
    declare apl_indic   "SAP_PA_APL"."sap.pa.apl.base::BASE.T.INDICATORS";   	
    declare apl_metr "SAP_PA_APL"."sap.pa.apl.base::BASE.T.DEBRIEF_METRIC_OID";
    declare apl_prop "SAP_PA_APL"."sap.pa.apl.base::BASE.T.DEBRIEF_PROPERTY_OID";      

    truncate table "SALES_PLANNING_DEMO#AI_USER"."APL_SERIES_OUT";
    truncate table "SALES_PLANNING_DEMO#AI_USER"."APL_FORECAST_ACCURACY";
    truncate table "SALES_PLANNING_DEMO#AI_USER"."APL_FORECAST_STATUS";
	
    :header.insert(('Oid', 'DSP APL'));
    :header.insert(('LogLevel', '2'));
    :header.insert(('MaxTasks', '4'));  --  PARALLEL TASKS

    :config.insert(('APL/SegmentColumnName', 'Entity',null)); 
    :config.insert(('APL/Horizon', '12',null));
    :config.insert(('APL/TimePointColumnName', 'Date',null));
	:config.insert(('APL/ForcePositiveForecast', 'true',null));
	:config.insert(('APL/DecomposeInfluencers', 'true',null));
	:config.insert(('APL/ApplyExtraMode', 'First Forecast with Stable Components and Residues and Error Bars',null));
	
    :var_role.insert(('Date', 'input', null, null, null));
    :var_role.insert(('SalesRevenue', 'target', null, null, null));
		
    "SAP_PA_APL"."sap.pa.apl.base::FORECAST_AND_DEBRIEF" (
	:header, :config, :var_desc, :var_role, 
	'SALES_PLANNING_DEMO#AI_USER', 'APL_SERIES_IN', 
	'SALES_PLANNING_DEMO#AI_USER', 'APL_SERIES_OUT', apl_log, apl_sum, apl_indic, apl_metr, apl_prop);

    insert into "SALES_PLANNING_DEMO#AI_USER"."APL_FORECAST_ACCURACY" 
    select "Oid" as "Entity", "MAE", "MAPE"
    from "SAP_PA_APL"."sap.pa.apl.debrief.report::TimeSeries_Performance" (:apl_prop, :apl_metr)
    where "Partition" = 'Validation';
	
	insert into "SALES_PLANNING_DEMO#AI_USER"."APL_FORECAST_STATUS" 
    select "OID" as "Entity", "VALUE" as "Task Status"
	from :apl_sum 
	where key = 'AplTaskStatus';
END

For our demo scenario we use the default APL forecasting method that automatically tries different hypotheses for trend, cycles and fluctuations, and eventually selects the combination that gives the best accuracy. For a faster processing on many segments, an option is to force the Exponential Smoothing method by adding to the procedure this line of code below: 

:config.insert(('APL/ForecastMethod','ExponentialSmoothing',null));

This is the code to prepare the target tables of the procedure: 

drop table APL_SERIES_OUT;
create table APL_SERIES_OUT (
 "Entity"  nvarchar(180),
 "Date" 	DATE,
 "SalesRevenue" DOUBLE,
 "kts_1" DOUBLE,
 "kts_1Trend" DOUBLE,
 "kts_1Cycles" DOUBLE,
 "kts_1_lowerlimit_95%" DOUBLE,
 "kts_1_upperlimit_95%" DOUBLE,
 "kts_1ExtraPreds" DOUBLE,
 "kts_1Fluctuations" DOUBLE,
 "kts_1Residues" DOUBLE
);

 

drop table APL_FORECAST_ACCURACY;
create table APL_FORECAST_ACCURACY (
 "Entity"  nvarchar(180),
 "MAE" DOUBLE,
 "MAPE" DOUBLE
);

 

drop table APL_FORECAST_STATUS;
create table APL_FORECAST_STATUS (
 "Entity"  nvarchar(180),
 "Task Status" nvarchar(180)
);
  • You can trigger this procedure manually using the command below: 
call "APL_FORECAST_TASK" ;

However, in the next chapter, we will also create a task chain in SAP Datasphere to trigger it which can be embedded in real workflows.  

  • You see we generate and write data into three different tables: 
  • The prediction result goes into our results table called APL_SERIES_OUT. This is the data that we want for our seamless planning model. The table has the concatenated entity, date and the predicted revenue. It also comes with upper and lower limit predictions (95%) as well as with fluctuations, extra predictions etc.  
     
  • Optionally, we create the table APL_FORECAST_ACCURACY to store the MAPE (Mean Absolute Percentage Error MAE (Mean Absolute Error) per entity. You could filter on the entities you are interested in, the best/worst entities etc. or you could get the MSE (Mean Squared Error) or RMSE (Root Mean Absolute Squared Error) as well.  

  • Optionally, we create the table APL_FORECAST_STATUS where we log the prediction status per entity. All our entities were successful.  

 

5. Task chain 

Stored procedures can be executed via task chains. As such, you can execute them from the SAP Datasphere UI, schedule them or trigger them via external API. Check out the task chain documentation to learn more about prerequisites such as required roles. Soon, you should be able to trigger this API via multi actions in SAP Analytics Cloud as well.  

We must allow the execution of the stored procedure via the SAP Datasphere UI including the creation and deletion of data in the database user schema:  

CALL "DWC_GLOBAL"."GRANT_PRIVILEGE_TO_SPACE" ( 
             OPERATION => 'GRANT',  
             PRIVILEGE => 'INSERT',  
             SCHEMA_NAME => 'SALES_PLANNING_DEMO#AI_USER',  
             OBJECT_NAME => '',  
             SPACE_ID => 'SALES_PLANNING_DEMO');

              

CALL "DWC_GLOBAL"."GRANT_PRIVILEGE_TO_SPACE" ( 
             OPERATION => 'GRANT',  
             PRIVILEGE => 'DELETE',  
             SCHEMA_NAME => 'SALES_PLANNING_DEMO#AI_USER',  
             OBJECT_NAME => '',  
             SPACE_ID => 'SALES_PLANNING_DEMO');

 

CALL "DWC_GLOBAL"."GRANT_PRIVILEGE_TO_SPACE" ( 
             OPERATION => 'GRANT',  
             PRIVILEGE => 'EXECUTE',  
             SCHEMA_NAME => 'SALES_PLANNING_DEMO#AI_USER',  
             OBJECT_NAME => '',  
             SPACE_ID => 'SALES_PLANNING_DEMO');

Setting up task chains is simple. To add a stored procedures, you select Others and browse through the available procedures that are available for your space. Then you drag the procedure on to the canvas to add it as a task.    

You can add replication flows, transformation flows, intelligent lookups etc. to your task chains. By that, you could for instance first refresh actuals and get them into shape so you can use them for your prediction. Or, you add an email notification task to receive updates after the execution of the task chain (I did that in the example below).  

6. Consuming results in the SAP Datasphere space 

Now that we have the predictive logic to calculate and we can execute it via the SAP Datasphere UI, we of course need to consume the forecast data in the planning model. To do that, we first need the results in the SAP Datasphere space. We create a view on top of the results table. We used a graphical view but depending on your preferences and skills, you may use an SQL view instead.  

  • Pull the results table from the DB user schema in the Sources tab. 

  • Add a calculation node to split the Entity column into regions and products again. Create two calculated columns (Product and Region) and use string functions.  The functions SUBSTR_BEFORE() and SUBSTR_AFTER() can be used to split a string using the first occurence of a specified pattern (in our case '|'  as the format of our Entity column is Product|Region). 

 Expression to derive product:

SUBSTR_BEFORE(Entity,'|')

Expression to derive region:

SUBSTR_AFTER(Entity,'|')
  •  Join the standard time dimension with day granularity to derive the calendar month from the date. Standard time tables and dimensions can be generated in Space Management (link).  

  • Add a projection and only keep the columns you need in the planning model. 
    • Calendar Month 
    • SalesRevenue 
    • Product 
    • Region 
  • Make sure to expose the view for consumption and select Fact as the Semantic Usage Type.  
  • Name the view and deploy.  

7. Adding the forecast result as live version in the seamless planning model 

We now move to SAP Analytics Cloud and add the forecast result to the seamless planning model as a live version.  

  • Connect external data source. 

  • Create a version to map the data into (or use an existing un-used version). 
  • Select the view. 
  • Map the columns. 
     
  • Preview the data. You see that we have a live connection to the forecast results in SAP Datasphere. So every time that the forecast is updated, it will be reflected in the planning model in real time! 

 

What (else) can/could you do with it?  

In SAP Analytics Cloud:  

  • You can display the live version data in the model data foundation and in tables, charts, etc. in stories. 
  • You can reference the live version data in model and story calculations as well as data actions (incl. advanced formulas). 
  • You cannot write back into the referenced views (or rather their underlying tables). But, you can copy the live version data into planning versions via copy/paste in the table, data actions and version management. 

In SAP Datasphere: 

  • You can of course leverage the forecast result in your views and analytic models and compare it to actuals, budgets, etc.  
  • You can run further transformations and calculations and report on the results or use them in planning.  
  • … 

 

Which new features can improve the workflow in the future? 

We are working on a couple of features that can make this scenario even better: 

  • Push data from SAP Datasphere into the seamless planning model via task chains:  
    Live versions are awesome. But, sometimes you want to use the prediction as a proposal and then edit it. You could copy the live version data into an editable version easily (see above) but with a push of data into the planning model, you could directly bring the data into an editable forecast version. That push could be nicely added to the same task chain that triggers the APL procedure. 
  • Trigger task chains from SAP Analytics Cloud:
    Task chains shall soon offer a public API for triggering task chain runs from outside of SAP Datasphere.
    We are getting ready on the SAP Analytics Cloud side to let you call this API via API steps in multi actions. With that, you could trigger the stored procedures from SAP Analytics Cloud.  
    Some day, we may have dedicated task chain steps in multi actions to ease this cross-orchestration. We also want to enable cross-orchestration in the opposite direction.  

 

Conclusion 

In this blogpost, Marc and I demonstrated how to integrate predictive forecast results from SAP HANA APL in a seamless planning model. We combined the power of SAP Datasphere, SAP HANA and SAP Analytics Cloud to achieve that in a quite straight-forward architecture. You could achieve more complex scenarios, use PAL instead to tweak your prediction more etc. Or you could use data products from SAP BDC to get you started even quicker.  

We are looking forward to the future enhancements that shall improve such workflows and the overall integration of planning into SAP BDC!
